sub_title: Freelance Chef & Caterer with 20 years experience, Event Manager (and anything to do with music and entertainment!)
summary:
CURRENT: Last 12 months: Freelance cook for 'Brut de Mer' (De Pijp, Amsterdam), 'Harbour Club' (Vinkeveen), 'Hotel Spaander (Volendam), 'Cantine de Caron' (Westerpark, Amsterdam), Art Ventura (Catering bedrijf, Amsterdam) 

During the pandemic I worked for the Dutch Municipal Health Service (GGD) as a Covid-19 tester and administrator.  I have also been a vaccination support worker. 

The previous four years, before the pandemic, I had followed my cooking passions, from cafes to 5 star hotels and everything in-between, as a freelance chef.
I completed a year long project in Limburg (NL) turning a bankrupt and outdated lunchroom into a successful evening restaurant.
Upon return, I project managed the building of a kitchen in a large restaurant in Amsterdam. 
Since the Limburg restaurant I was not fully running my tent and event company, and only on an occasional basis hiring them out. One cant do everything at once and, with two small children, something had to give! But thats rapidly becoming history...

A great positive of the pandemic is the time to reflect that it has given me with a renewed passion for everything involved with entertainment. 
Naturally I'll continue with my passion for food and work within the industry, but with my children now somewhat older, I'm also actively seeking work in the events sector.

In the past I have managed my own company as an event organiser, artist manger and promoter. Combined with my vast catering, restaurant and hospitality experience, it has given me a tremendous oversight of location management and tailor-made concepts. With my dome tents, I created festival-style weddings, as well as using them for other events.

I also have an extensive knowledge and passion for music and film. I have worked as part of a audio/visual DJ outfit (video editing and sound production of our own material) and performed this at large festivals and events around the world. None of this would have been possible without having an eye for marketing.  I have also re-scored and edited soundtracks for classic films that have been shown in prestigious  locations in and around Amsterdam. I also continue to produce and release electronic music in my spare time.
The next adventure awaits, and I'm ready to get my hands dirty, with the enduring attitude that a jobs not over until its finished!

profile_positions.description:
Exploitation of three large dome tents, with sound and catering equipment. These were used in creative stage concepts at large festivals such as Mysteryland and smaller festivals such as Beyond. I also used the smaller tents for catering and food stalls. Most recently they were used for 'festival style' weddings. I would tailor the event to the couples requests and produce it from end to end.
As this was very specialist (sometimes not large enough or the right 'feel') I decided to put the company on hold to explore wider possibilities that were year round.

profile_positions.description:
This was a one year project. My brother-in-law had bought a bankrupt lunchroom (70 seats inside, 40 terrace) and needed someone to turn it around before it could be resold. Together with my wife, we successfully turned the location into a well running evening business. We recognised and catered for the average demographic of Valkenburg (a very touristic location).
All aspects of the management, kitchen, promotion and personnel were realised by us.
One year later it was sold for almost double the original investment.
profile_positions.title: Proprietor and Chef

profile_positions.description:
For my DJ/ Production history see: http://www.simonmelia.blogspot.com

Based in Amsterdam, The SmokeEaters are futuristic DJs who manipulate audio and video images using DVD turntables, mixers and computers, seamlessly bringing together music videos, movies and television combined with electronic dance beats. The SmokeEaters are quickly rising in the AV scene becoming recognised as innovators alongside contemporary peers like DJ Yoda, Coldcut and Hextatic.
Having already headlined the legendary Paradiso club in their native Amsterdam on several occasions, The SmokeEaters are now bringing their talents to an international audience playing venues as far afield as Family nightclub in Brisbane, Australia and closer to home in Spain, Belgium, Poland, and Romania. Summer 2010 saw them introduced to the festival circuit to rock the legendary Glastonbury Festival with 2 shows in the huge Dance East tent as well as playing for 3 nights at Ireland's premier festival Oxegen on a 100m HI Def LED screen – one of the biggest in the world. They rounded off the Summer with an outdoor show with massive 360 degree projections at Hungary’s Sziget Festival http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v1VcXVfdXfM
The SmokeEaters sample from all areas of pop, rock and dance culture.

Duties included: Artist bookings, promotion, creative design, personnel hire and stage management. 

Also I became an agent simply as it was more cost effective to take foreign artists to other venues within the Benelux, thus reducing my financial overheads. This in turn, became one of my main incomes during this period.

Another function: Canvassing the distributors to push more of the relevant music into the shops became also a major aspect of my work. This lead to my initiating a club promotion service, where certain journalists and top ‘players’ received free vinyl in exchange for reactions.

2001 – Income was solely from DJing and some album launch parties/ club nights. Also first release with R&S Records under the name: Sub Soundsystem
